name: Cabin Series II - Hand Towel - Deer Tracks in Sunshine
description:
WOVEN BY HAND ON OLD WOODEN FLOOR LOOMS
Belgian and Lithuanian Linen
24" wide x 24" wide
Design:  Deer Tracks
Color:  Sunshine

The Cabin Series – DEER TRACKS DESIGN story. . .

Each morning at the cabin I take the dogs for a walk.  I take the leashes from the pegs just in case we go as far as the big road.  The dogs see me and instantly know it is their favorite time of day!  They crowd around me as I try to get the door open, each of them wedging their way into the crack, making it impossible to open the door without scraping over one of their feet.  We struggle as I try to contain their frenzy and suddenly the door is open and they burst out, certain that THIS time they will come home with a prize!  They work their way up the cabin road, zig-zagging from one side to the other, lost in the scents left from the night before.  I follow, far behind, looking at the fresh deer tracks in the soft sandy gravel, knowing that a deer passed this way not moments before.

A modified waffle weave was used to mimic the tracks of a deer in these textiles.  This is an especially ‘thirsty’ towel due to the nature of its weave structure, comprised of mini-‘pockets’ that trap moisture.  A 10 harness computer-aided loom was used to skillfully hand weave these towels with fine craftsmanship.  They are woven in high quality 100 percent imported linen in a complex twill weave structure.

name: Cabin Series II - Hand Towel - Snowflake in New Leaf with Dreamsicle
description:
WOVEN BY HAND ON OLD WOODEN FLOOR LOOMS
Belgian and Lithuanian Linen
24" wide x 24" long
Design:  Snowflake
Color:  New Leaf with Dreamsicle

The Cabin Series  –  SNOWFLAKE DESIGN story . . . 

This past Christmas, as with every Christmas, we made the journey to our cabin to spend the whole holiday as a family, cozy in our warm little cabin.  We had lots to do when we got there; unload the car and unpack, get water and food for the dogs after the long trip, turn up the temperature on the boiler, run the water lines to freshen the water coming out, shovel the walks and decks, start a fire in the fireplace, and put up the Christmas tree!  And it always seems to be snowing even if only a little bit.  And the flakes are huge!    As we stood out on the freshly shoveled deck looking out at the frozen lake, we were surprised to realize the flakes, although large, were as light as air and when they landed on our faces there was a startling instant of clear cold and then they melted on our cheeks, leaving only a pinpoint of moisture as evidence they were there at all.

With those chilly, snowy days in mind, I designed these towels to hint at the snowflakes of our cabin.  Each towel is made from elegant Belgian and Lithuanian Linen, and handwoven in a complex weave structure with refined craftsmanship!

name: Cabin Series II - Hand Towel - Cabin Road in New Leaf
description:
WOVEN BY HAND ON OLD WOODEN FLOOR LOOMS
Belgian and Lithuanian Linen
24" wide x 24" long
Design:  Cabin Road
Color:  New Leaf

The Cabin Series II
CABIN ROAD DESIGN story . . .

Each spring we make a trip to the cabin to get it ready for the summer.  We are so ready to shed our winter coats and boots and feel the sand between our toes.  We can’t wait to get our first glimpse of the cabin without all the snow covering its roof and decks.  Are we too early to hear the call of the loons as they come back again this year to our little lake?  Will the wild trillium still be blooming?  As we approach the turn-off to the road leading to the cabin we are all thinking about the fun we will be having there in the summer and are excited to be able to get out of the car and get that first breath of cabin-fresh air!  At last!  We are at the road leading down to the cabin.  It is a rough two rutted gravel road, with a center strip of grasses, weeds and flowers all reaching for the sunlight.  It is a steep and winding road down which we have to drive slowly, as we listen to the tires make their gravel popping noises and listen to the grasses rub the underside of the car in a hushing brush of sounds.  These are the first sounds of the cabin in the spring!
The thin stripes of these towels, made of 100 percent fine imported linen, evoke the impression of the gravel and grass road that leads down to our cabin.  These textiles are skillfully handwoven on a 16 harness floor loom with fine craftsmanship.  Each towel is a wonderful piece of art for your spa, bath, or kitchen to be used in your everyday living.

name: Cabin Series II - Spa Towel - Pine in New Leaf with Violet
description:
WOVEN BY HAND ON OLD WOODEN FLOOR LOOMS
Belgian and Lithuanian Linen
24" wide x 42" long
Design:  Pine
Color:  New Leaf with Violet

The Cabin Series  –  PINE DESIGN story . . .

As a child growing up spending summers at my parent’s cabin I was lucky enough to have extended family close by. We had a cluster of cabins located on a large piece of acreage that jutted out into our lake located in Northern Minnesota. My maternal aunts and uncles, many of them professors and teachers, spent summers there. With many cousins as playmates we would swim all day, coming in only for lunch and mid-afternoon coffee, where we would have home-made root beer and cookies. On the cloudier, cool days, when swimming wasn't possible, we would hike to the middling pines which my father had planted years before, each of us climbing up to the top of a pine tree, grasping onto the thinning trunk and swaying in the breeze. Sometimes the breeze turned to blustery winds which would blow enough causing us to lose our grip sending us roaring with laughter and raucous delight, to the soft thick forest floor of 
pine needles.

These hand towels are designed with those pine trees in mind. They are 100 percent imported linen, hand-woven on a floor loom in a ten harness complex twill structure. Each towel is colorful art for the kitchen or bathroom, providing quiet elegance through a wonderfully functional decoration! When you receive your purchase, it will have been Cold Mangled, giving each towel that Old-World sheen for which linen is known!

name: Cabin  Series II - Bath Towel - Aspen Leaf in Sunshine
description:
WOVEN BY HAND ON OLD WOODEN FLOOR LOOMS
Belgian and Lithuanian Linen
36" wide x 60" long
Design:  Aspen Leaf
Color: Sunshine

The Cabin Series  –  ASPEN LEAF DESIGN story . . .

Our cabin is surrounded by a towering canopy of Aspens, their tall trunks reaching for the sky in competition with each other to get the most light.  A walk through the forest seems as though one is walking through a woods composed of telephone poles, so tall and straight are the aspen trees! The canopy of leaves, so high up, seems like glittering clouds of green and silver, fluttering wildly as if to get the attention of the sun.  These fluttering Aspen leaves are the inspiration for the Aspen Design!

These 24” x24” hand towels are inspired by those fluttering Aspen leaves.  The 10 harness complex twill structure captures and reflects light in a delightful shimmer of cascading linen.  They are 100 percent imported linen, personally handwoven on a floor loom. Each towel represents skilled craftsmanship in weaving and an attractive piece of art for your spa or bath, providing quiet elegance through a wonderfully functional decoration! When you receive your purchase, it will have been Cold Mangled, giving each towel that Old-World sheen for which linen is known!

name: Cabin Series II - Tablerunner - Snowflake in Slate
description:
100% Belgian and Lithuanian linen
12" wide X 36" long
Design:  Snowflake
Color:  Slate

name: 100% Pure Linen Yarn - NEU
description:
100% Linen from Lithuanian
European NM 9.5/2; 2 ply, 4,750 meters/Kilo.

We are proud to announce that we are stocking our yarn for the consumer and retailer!! This is a unique opportunity to obtain the same high quality European linen yarn as is used here in our studio!

We import our linen from 2 mills which are located in the region of Europe where climate and precipitation come together to provide the richest growing environment for flax found nowhere else in the world. They are also both members of Masters of Linen, the European organization which resides over the quality and pureness, and environmental impacts of the linen, from seed to cloth.﻿﻿

We have found that importing our own linen yarn which is made to our own specifications in color, weight, twist, and finishing, is the only way to obtain the highest quality linen yarn and still make prices affordable to the retail market.﻿﻿

name: 100% Pure Linen Yarn - AGA
description:
100% Linen from Lithuanian 
European NM 9.5/2; 2 ply, 4,750 meters/Kilo.

We are proud to announce that we are stocking our yarn for the consumer and retailer!!  This is a unique opportunity to obtain the same premium quality European linen yarn as is used here in our studio!

We import our linen from 2 mills which are located in the region of Europe where climate and precipitation come together to provide the richest growing environment for flax found anywhere in the world.  They are also both members of 'The Masters of Linen', the European organization which resides over the quality and pureness, and the environmental impacts of the linen from its inception as seed to its culmination as cloth.

We have found that importing our own linen yarn which is made to our own specifications in color, weight, twist, and finishing, is the only way to obtain the highest quality linen yarn and still make prices affordable to the retail market.
